Articles.Content: Looks like a good project to get in to.
There are more testers than developers for KSP.

Achron is a multilayer rts with time travel. It works by caching the players commands and propagating them into the future. Awesome game with working multiplayer time travel.

Might have some good ideas for time warp and such.

http://www.achrongame.com/site/
When you guys have some code done I would do a pre-release video for you if you wanted it.
So how's it going so far? Any updates?

So well, I'm trying to create a new logo for this project. Goes great for now!

Edited June 20, 2013 by BlueSubstance
Grammar...

There are more testers than developers for KSP.

Arent we... all testers of it?
No, we get the most stable released that a bunch of people test; they're called "experimentals"

So how's it going so far? Any updates?

Because the team is now big enaugh to start, we are now trying to find a way to make a simple server to transmit data (mostly variables) to clients.

It will take a time before the first showcase will be here. But of course, here are development news, so look up frequently!

@Bluesubstance: Nice, looking forward to it! Could you make a flag too? Just for any fututre showcases, that you will see a L.O.G. flag? It could be the logo you are working on, rescaled and cropped for example.

Edited June 20, 2013 by MarkusA380

Achron is a multilayer rts with time travel. It works by caching the players commands and propagating them into the future. Awesome game with working multiplayer time travel.

Might have some good ideas for time warp and such.

http://www.achrongame.com/site/

It seems to be hardly the same idea!

It seems to be hardly the same idea!

Yes but how they deal with two multiplayer clients being out of sync chronologically is not different for what you are trying to accomplish. They do some clever stuff as far as predicting and dealing with paradoxes.
Please welcome NULLOBANDITO as tester, again...
Please welcome the two new developers!
Err, they are welcomed!

Our flag for showcase purposes:

Click on the flag for the original image. It is a .png already, so just move it to your flags folder.

so how are we going to share files?

i don't like svn's as they slowdown my computer

i think dropbox is best

so how are we going to share files?

i don't like svn's as they slowdown my computer

i think dropbox is best

Right! I have installed dropbox already, I think it's the best!

So guys, just discovered this thread and i was wondering how this was getting on?

BTW this has a lot of potential (compared to other multiplayer mods)

Drop-box when programming on a project with multiple people.. Doesn't sound like a good idea.

Maybe github as suggested in the addon forum?

how do you use git hub anyway?

i can never find a download anywhere
This looks promising, good luck on the development.

how do you use git hub anyway?

i can never find a download anywhere

On the github website is a client. I don't use it. I use tortoise GIT, as I am familiar with tortoise (I use tortoise CVS, SVN, GIT & HG at work). This assumes you're using Windows though.

And this project really should use a change management system. Without it, it will fail.
Any big news to update with us yet?
as i said i don't like svn's as they slow down my pc
